name: Hyatt Place Salt Lake City

reviews.text: We staid for 10 days during a conference. The room price included free wifi (which worked quite well) and breakfast. In addition, breakfast take away was also possible without additional charge. The hotel is situated in a very convenient location close to the trax that leads to the airport and close to downtown as well. The furniture is not super new, but the rooms are big and comfortable enough. What really made our stay nice though was the friendly and positive attitude of the personnel.
reviews.title: Friendly staff and nice rooms

reviews.text: We stayed at the SLC Hyatt Place on Friday, April 19th. What a great place. Check in was a breeze. We had a great view of the downtown area, and the room size was huge (2 queens). The location can't be beat, with the shops right there as well as a quick walk to Temple Square and the tram. Breakfast was outstanding. Just about anything you could think of, and lots of fresh fruit (which is all included in the rate). Parking was $10. I'd highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel and location!

reviews.text: The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and very modern. The rooms are set up with a divider between the "living space" and "bedroom". You can tell the hotel has been overhauled to this new set up but it's totally working. I thought the bed was super comfortable. I brought my own pillow so I can't say if the pillows were comfy or not. The room was super clean. The room was super quiet even though we were on the first floor facing the street (our window next to the bed looked out onto the street). I have to say the staff was soooo nice. I never expect nice staff at a hotel so I was shocked when every time we passed by or interacted with the front desk they were nice and helpful. I don't know if it's a Salt Lake City thing or if they just have incredible staff. There is a ten dollar a day charge for parking (you cannot enter the hotel parking lot unless you have a room key which is nice so you always have a parking spot). I don't remember seeing that when I made the reservation for the hotel so that was unexpected but not a huge problem. If you don't pay to park I have no idea where you would park otherwise. I think this is the first time I ever reviewed a hotel and have absolutely no negatives to say about it. Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Beautiful and Nice Staff

reviews.text: This property know exactly how to make your stay pleasant. Everything was clean, the service was excellent and the grounds were quiet. A basic room consisted of a full kitchen with granite couters and wood flooring, an open living room area, and a bedroom. The bathroom was very spacious and modern. Overall, I would give this property a 6 if it was allowed.
reviews.title: A first class experience

reviews.text: Hyatt place was comfortable , clean , spacious and the employees were very courteous and accomadating. The location was right next to a very nice mall. The size of the room was large and the very nicely decorated room and the sofa bed was even comfortable. The room displayed a 42" LG tv. The employees made you feel welcome and were eager to be of assistance. Hyatt Place is top notch!
reviews.title: We would definitely stay again!

reviews.text: From check-in to check-out our hotel stay was great. The front desk staff was extremely friendly and very accommodating. Hotel entrance was clean and planted with nice blooming flowers. When we checked in there was fresh ice water available along with a bowl of apples for a snack. Rooms were clean and spacious. Breakfast was better than your typical hotel breakfast. The bananas were fresh and they always had a nice bowl of apples. It's hard to find nice fresh fruit when traveling, but this hotel did a great job. We had several rooms booked for our family and everyone enjoyed their stay. The location was very convenient. It's a great hotel, our stay was wonderful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel with gracious, friendly, and effective staff. My room was far better than expected with a seating area, very comfortable bed, super clean room, and capable housekeeping staff. Every request for information or assistance was met promptly and professionally by friendly staff. I don't know where they found these folks, but they are gems.
reviews.title: Very very nice
Second time here!
reviews.text: Our second time staying here! And it was saint patrick's day! the road in front of the hotel and to the sides were closed for the parade. But the staffs were able to stop the parade in between if you want to leave. Staffs were really helpful and friendly. And it was definitely an eye opening for us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel since its just a few minutes walk away from the gateway shopping. Parking is big too, although there is a daily charge of $10 for parking. The rooms are very spacious. First stay was a king bed room, second was a 2 queen bed room. Breakfast is better than just average.
reviews.title: You won't be disappointed

reviews.text: Super clean, comfortable and conveniently located for the airport and walking distance to downtown. In a very safe feeling part of town. The staff makes you feel like home. Breakfast is above average. 2nd stay here and we will definitely stay here on our next trip.
reviews.title: Great Location Close to Dining, Shopping and Arena

reviews.text: We really liked this hotel. The rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable. There was a nice sitting room area with a sofa bed and refridgerator. They had a nice continental breakfast from 6:30-9:30 am. It was right next to a shopping center with a lot of really nice restaurants. I also liked that their fitness room was open 24 hours. The only downsides were a $10 per day parking fee and the AC unit was located next to one of the beds and did not disperse air evenly (really cold if you were in the bed next to it). Other than that, it's a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Our stay at this hotel was quite flawless. The check in went quick and they were super helpful. The room was expansive and the pillows were nice and soft. VERY comfortable sleep. I would have given my stay a 5, but at breakfast there were only spoons available so we had to pick up our pancakes/sausage with our fingers. Other than that, everything was topnotch.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: The Positive: The staff was very friendly. The breakfast good.
reviews.title: Not up to Hyatt Standards

reviews.text: The Not So Positive: The coffee pot was not cleaned from the last persons. Old coffee grounds still in the pot. When we showered, the tub filled half full with water. Badly needed drain cleaner. For some reason, the fitted sheets kept coming off the bed. One sheet corner had blood stains. Very disappointing.
reviews.title: Great 3 star property

reviews.text: Stayed here one night beginning of June. The location is ideal for downtown tourist and business alike. It is right next door to the Gateway Mall where there is shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. They suggested eating at Red Iguana which has excellent moles.
reviews.title: Great Service!

reviews.text: The front desk staff at this hotel is wonderful! Very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The breakfast is also wonderful. Much nicer than most free hotel breakfasts we've had. Our room was clean and comfortable although it had a bit of a strange odor. I think it may have been the cleaning products they use? Overall, we had a great stay.
reviews.title: Great staff and breakfast!
Perfect place to stay in SLC!
reviews.text: We LOVED out four night stay at the Hyatt Place. Super friendly staff, immaculately clean lobby, elevators, room, pool and fitness room! The actual room was huge, just what we needed. The breakfast was great, having eggs, sausage, pancakes or French toast, bagels, fresh oatmeal, juices, milk, fruit, yogurt and I'm sure I missed a few things. The hotel was just a short walk to the SLC Trax system, one form of public transportation. But it's free to ride when in the downtown area, and it takes you past temple square, the city center with amazing shops and many more places. The hotel is also a short walk from the gateway center, which has additional amazing shops, and restaurants. It was easy to get to the hotel from I-15, and easy to park, etc. we will staying here when we come back to SLC. Good job Hyatt Place! You made our stay amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hyatt Place Salt Lake City for two nights. It is a fairly typical Hyatt Place with a nice sitting room and very comfortable bed. When we checked in, we were given a corner room - which is much smaller that the standard Hyatt Place room (the sitting area was practically nonexistent and we specifically chose Hyatt Place so we would have a pleasant sitting area). Fortunately they had a larger room available and we were able to move. Breakfast was O.K. but pretty chaotic. The food was typical of what is offered for a complimentary breakfast in many hotels/motels.
reviews.title: Fairly Typical Hyatt Place/Pay For Parking/Fabulous Staff
Wonderful Wedding Stay
reviews.text: The hotel staff was extremely courteous and helpful. Probably the nicest, most sincere staff I have ever encountered.

One caveat: there is a charge for parking and the parking lot fills up early. Nowhere on their website did Hyatt Place SLC mention a charge for parking, and I do think it should be stated on the website. We were visiting family, so were out in the evening. The first evening we got back to the hotel around 8 and there were two or three spots opened. The next evening we got back around 10 and there were no spots left in the entire lot. Fortunately, just as we were about to pull out of the lot someone came out of the hotel and left, so we were able to get their spot.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

aka: Hyatt Place Salt Lake City Hotel
